Params: {3: "Having been pierced multiple times, Lithos' body all but completely shatters on the ground."}
{3: "How many deaths is this now? It doesn't matter. No one cares."}
{3: 'At best, this tedious life of his causes the best of heroes nothing but disgust.'}
{3: 'Whether this battle happened or not, dying at the predetermined time as he has promised is a mission he must complete.'}
{3: 'Next, his consciousness will merge with Cthylla\'s cradle—after which he will replace the "traitor" who died as the new "joystick."'}
{3: "His consciousness is not like the traitor's, so he can't last long in the cradle."}
{3: 'Which is why he has to time it perfectly—so that he can trap the Gray Raven Commandant without any hiccup when the final moment comes.'}
{3: '"Which is good enough. Mission is complete, and everything went according to plan," he says to himself.'}
{3: 'If there\'s liable to change in this plan, it\'s that Lamia and the "traitor" who led Cthylla away haven\'t been dealt with.'}
{3: "But he can't wait any longer. If the cradle continues to collapse, everything will be buried at the bottom of this deep sea."}
{3: 'But he doesn\'t have a choice but to leave the two variables in the hands of his "other self"—who\'s merged with Cthylla.'}
{2: 'Lithos', 3: 'Then consider it the revenge of a "replica" on him...'}
{3: 'After all... he only values the real Lithos as "he is now."'}
{3: 'Step by step, Lamia walks up to Lithos as she keeps her eyes on him. Lithos, on the other hand, keeps a satisfied smile on his face—even when his head is penetrated.'}
{3: '"This is good enough. Mission is complete, and everything went according to plan," he lies to himself.'}
